summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 2019 regarding the weekly Epstein Significant Activity Report (SAR). It provides a status update on victim outreach and services, reporting that 24 victims had been contacted (17 in New York, 7 in Miami) and that services were being coordinated for 5 more. The email discusses the types of services offered to victims.

events.title: Victim Outreach Status Update
events.description: An internal FBI email provides a status update on victim outreach for the Epstein case, reporting that 24 victims had been spoken to and offered services, with 5 more in process.

keyFacts: As of August 15, 2019, the FBI had spoken to and offered services to 24 victims in the Epstein case (17 in New York, 7 in Miami).
Services offered to victims included interview assistance, crisis counseling, media information, and counseling referrals.
The FBI was in the process of coordinating services for 5 additional victims at the time of the email.
This document shows the FBI was maintaining a weekly Significant Activity Report (SAR) to track victim outreach and services in the Epstein investigation.
